# SOLUTION
# The idea is to sort the weights and then match the weights from the beginning and the end of the list.
# This way we can find the maximum number of pairs with the same weight.

t = int(input())

for _ in range(t):
    n = int(input())
    weights = list(map(int, input().split()))
    weights.sort()
    i = 0
    j = n - 1
    count = 0
    while i < j:
        if weights[i] + weights[j] == weights[i + 1] + weights[j - 1]:
            count += 1
            i += 1
            j -= 1
        elif weights[i] + weights[j] > weights[i + 1] + weights[j - 1]:
            i += 1
        else:
            j -= 1
    print(count)
